parameters.text: 'KEGG_compounds.msgpack'

parameters.name: strict
parameters.text: FALSE

parameters.name: precursors
parameters.text:
a character vector of the precursor adducts type,
apply for the precursor m/z evaluation.

parameters.name: mzdiff
parameters.text: a tolerance error value for make ms1 matches

parameters.name: repofile
parameters.text:
the local database file for the kegg compounds. should be a
messagepack data file of a collection of the GCModeller compound object.

parameters.name: strict
parameters.text:
option strict for check of the file exists or not of the repo file.
an error was throw if the given repo file is missing from the local filesystem,
or use the kegg compound data repo file from GCModeller internal resource file
if not strict and also the given repo file is invalid

kegg_compounds.returns: a wrapper of the mass search engine which have kegg compound library loaded.
kegg_compounds.title: Load the kegg database for the annotation

parameters.name: repofile
parameters.text: 'system.file'('data/LIPIDMAPS.msgpack', 'package' = 'mzkit')

parameters.name: gsea
parameters.text: FALSE

parameters.name: category
parameters.text: FALSE

parameters.name: repofile
parameters.text:
the file path of the messagepack repository
data file. default file path is the internal data file
in mzkit package.

parameters.name: gsea
parameters.text: the lipidmaps database should be cast to a gsea background?

lipidmaps_repo.returns: a data seuqnece of lipidmaps metadata
lipidmaps_repo.title: Load lipidmaps data repository from internal data pack

parameters.name: lazy
parameters.text: FALSE

parameters.name: filepath
parameters.text:
the file path of the lipidmaps database file, ``structures.sdf`` file,
which could be download from the lipidmaps website via the file download url:
https://lipidmaps.org/files/?file=LMSD&ext=sdf.zip

parameters.name: kind
parameters.text: 'ppm'

parameters.name: kind
parameters.text: da method or ppm method.

parameters.name: mzdiff
parameters.text: the m/z tolerance error value.

parameters.name: sampleinfo
parameters.text: NULL

parameters.name: sampleinfo
parameters.text:
the sample information for the missing impute. this parameter
value could be a file path to the sampleinfo dataframe file, or a dataframe
object that contains the required fields for the sample info:
+ ``id`` is the sample id and used for the sample file name association;
+ ``name`` is the sample name and used for the sample name display;
+ ``group`` is the sample group information and used for the missing row data
impute and data filter in the processing.

preprocessing_expression.returns:
a result data matrix has been normalized
via total sum of the peak area.
preprocessing_expression.title: Normalize matrix sample data

parameters.name: data
parameters.text:
a data list object that should contains
group sample raw data of the target metabolite
ion. the list key name is the sample id and the
list element data is the corresponding sample
intensity data.

parameters.name: sampleinfo
parameters.text:
a list data that should contains
the data sample group tag information. the data
structre of this list could be two fields are
required at least:
+ group: the sample group name
+ id: a character vector that contains the sample
id to get intensity vector data from the
``data`` parameter.

ANOVAGroup.returns:
a dataframe object that contains two fields:
``intensity`` and ``region_group``, which could be
used for do stat chartting plot liked bar/box/violin
and also could be used for evaluated ANOVA F-test
p-value result.
ANOVAGroup.title: Create a dataset for evaluate ANOVA p-value

parameters.name: files
parameters.text: the file path collection of the raw data files.

the file names of the linear reference samples should be
the content value like: ``100ppm``, ``50ppb``, etc.
This method will parse the contents value from the ``calfiles``
file name.

GCMS_contentTable.title: Create content levels table

parameters.name: mslIons
parameters.text: NULL

parameters.name: output.dir
parameters.text: './linears'

output_datatables.details:
this function will output 4 tables in the target ``output_dir`` folder.
the 4 tables that saved in target folder contains:
+ ``quantify.csv`` the linear quantify content result table
+ ``rawX.csv`` the raw peak area data table, if the metabolite has ``IS`` calibration,
then the value of this table will be the peak area to IS peak area ratio
values.
+ ``linears.csv`` the linear equation table.
+ ``ionPeaks.csv`` all ions peak ROI in all samples files, data in this table contains
``rt`` range and peak area, etc.
output_datatables.title: Output result data table

parameters.name: unit
parameters.text: 'Minute'

ionPairsFromMsl.details:
this function will auto handling of the MSL ions
data source of the raw dataset or raw file path of the
ions data in MSL file format.

parameters.name: ions
parameters.text: the MSL ions dataset or a file path for read MSL ions data.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.text:
the data unit of the time values that stored in
the MSL ions data, default is in unit of minute.

ionPairsFromMsl.returns:
A data collection of ion pairs dataset for run
MRM data quantification.
ionPairsFromMsl.title: Read ion pairs data from MSL dataset
